What is Newton's first law of motion?
Answer: An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an external force.
Distractor1: The force acting on an object is equal to the mass of the object times its acceleration.
Distractor2: For every action| there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Distractor3: The rate of change of momentum of an object is directly proportional to the force applied.

What is the difference between mitosis and meiosis?
Answer: Meiosis produces four unique haploid cells while mitosis produces two identical diploid cells.
Distractor1: Mitosis produces four unique haploid cells while meiosis produces two identical diploid cells.
Distractor2: Meiosis produces two identical diploid cells while mitosis produces four unique haploid cells.
Distractor3: Mitosis produces two identical diploid cells while meiosis produces four unique haploid cells.
